meanings.definition: To discard or forget knowledge or skills that have been previously learned.
meanings.sent1: I need to unlearn the wrong way to solve this math problem.
meanings.sent2: It is important to unlearn bad habits to improve oneself.
meanings.sent3: Trying to unlearn how to tie my shoes is like trying to forget how to ride a bike.
meanings.sent4: She had to unlearn her fear of public speaking to succeed in her new job.
meanings.sent5: Unlearning old beliefs can be as challenging as learning new ones.

meanings.definition: To reverse the process of learning something.
meanings.sent1: He had to unlearn the steps of the dance routine to learn the new one.
meanings.sent2: It can be difficult to unlearn a language once you have become fluent.
meanings.sent3: She tried to unlearn how to bake a cake, but it kept turning out delicious.
meanings.sent4: Unlearning his past mistakes was the key to his future success.
meanings.sent5: Unlearning old habits can open up new possibilities for growth.
